description: Sm (Smith) is a small nuclear ribonucleoprotein composed of several polypeptides of differing molecular weights. They include B/B’, D, E, F, and G, which range in size from 9 kD to 29.5 kD. The principle reactivity has been shown to reside in the B/B’, and D polypeptides. Sm is one of the autoantigens commonly referred to as extractable nuclear antigens (ENA).
name: Sm Ag Antibodies and Antigens
